title: Lawḥ-i-Hawdaj
author: Bahá’u’lláh
source_preview: تِلْكَ آياتٌ ظَهَرَتْ فِيْ خِدْرِ الْبَقاءِ وَهَوْدَجِ الْقُدْسِ حِيْنَ وُرُوْدِ اسْمِ الأَعْظَمِ عَنْ شَطْرِ السُّبْحانِ فِيْ أَرْضِ الصَّامْصُونِ يَمَّ بَحْرٍ عَظِيْمٍ، إِذًا نُزِّلَتْ جُنُوْدُ وَحْيِ اللهِ بِطِرازِ الذِيْ انْصَعَقَتْ عَنْها كُلُّ مَنْ فِي السَّمواتِ وَالأَرَضِيْنَ، وَأَشْرَقَتْ قُدَّامَهُمْ شَمْسُ الْجَمالِ فِيْ هَيْكَلِ قُدْسٍ لَطِيْفٍ، وَخاطَبَ الْفُلْكَ بِما جَرَى مِنْ قَلَمِ اللهِ مِنْ قَبْلُ فِيْ لَوْحِ الَّذِيْ خاطَبْنا فِيْهِ ملاَّح الْقُدْسِ بِنِدآءِ حُزْنٍ خَفِيٍّ، و
description: Written upon Bahá’u’lláh’s arrival on the shores of the Black Sea en route to Istanbul, announcing the fulfilment of what was foretold in the ‘Tablet of the Holy Mariner’ a short time before, and warning of an impending ‘grievous and tormenting mischief ’ that would serve as the ‘divine touchstone’ separating truth from error.
subjects: power of the Manifestation of God
divine unity [tawhid] and degrees of unity
tests and trials; sacrifice and suffering
forgiveness; a sin-covering eye; patience and forbearance
cover_description: Leather: deep maroon-crimson with aged patina. Border: gold Persian geometric lattice and interlocking knots. Scene: an ascending dove trailing streams of divine light. Below this, seven celestial orbs arranged in an arc against a starfield. solemn, luminous
